clinical_study.brief_title: Diving for Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
clinical_study.official_title: Post Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD): Benefits of Diving Practice on Patient Quality of Life
clinical_study.source: Institut de Recherche Biomedicale des Armees

brief_summary.textblock: within the components of Scuba diving there are similarities with meditation and mindfulness techniques. PTSD and emotion dysregulation are known to be involved by meditation training This study evaluates the benefits of scuba diving on quality of life and mindful functioning comparing the benefits of diving training using a clinical trial protocol

primary_outcome.measure: quality of life (Mental Health Continuum-Short Form (MHC-SF))
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline (after the course minus baseline), (1month after the course minus baseline) and (3months after the course minus baseline)
primary_outcome.description: four times (baseline, after the course, 1month after the course and 3months after the course)

secondary_outcome.measure: post-traumatic checklist scale; a 20-item self-report scale assessing the 20 DSM-5 symptoms of PTSD with a symptom severity from 0 to 80 and a cut-point score of 33.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline (after the course minus baseline), (1month after the course minus baseline) and (3months after the course minus baseline
secondary_outcome.description: four times (baseline, after the course, 1month after the course and 3months after the course)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes from baseline (after the course minus baseline), (1month after the course minus baseline) and (3months after the course minus baseline
secondary_outcome.description: four times (baseline, after the course, one month after the course and 3 months after the course)

arm_group.description: training course lasting 10 days. It included 10 days of multisports practice once (2h) per day.
diving course lasting 10 days. It included 10 days of diving once (2h) per day. Diving will be carried out using air at a maximum depth of 30-meters

intervention.description: the intervention was a training course lasting 10 days. It included 10 days of sports practice. For divers, diving was carried out using air at a maximum depth of 40-meters, with a maximum of one dives a day. For the multisport group (the non-divers), the course included kayaking, mountain climbing or hiking with a maximum of two activities a day.
